t: Psalm 116
Thanks to God for Deliverance
I*pn love the Lord*s because he has heard my*ln appeal for mercy.
Because*ln he has turned his ear to me, I*ln will call out to him as long as I live.
The*pn ropes of death were wrapped around me, and*ln the torments of Sheol overcame me; I*ln encountered trouble and sorrow.
Then*ln I called on the name of the Lord:*s “Lord,*sln save me!”
The*pn Lord*s is gracious and righteous; our*ln God is compassionate.
The*ln Lord*s guards the inexperienced; I*ln was helpless, and he saved me.
Return*ln to your rest, my soul, for*ln the Lord*s has been good to you.
For*ln you, Lord,*s rescued me from death, my*ln eyes from tears, my*ln feet from stumbling.
I*ln will walk before the Lord*s in*ln the land of the living.
I*ln believed, even when I said, “I*ln am severely oppressed.”
In*ln my alarm I said, “Everyone*ln is a liar.”
How*pn can I repay the Lord*s for*ln all the good he has done for me?
I*ln will take the cup of salvation and*ln call on the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln will fulfill my vows to the Lord*s in*ln the presence of all his people.
The*pn death of his faithful ones is*ln valuable in the Lord’s*s sight.
Lord,*sln I am indeed your servant; I*ln am your servant, the son of your female servant. You*ln have loosened my bonds.
I*pn will offer you a thanksgiving sacrifice and*ln call on the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln will fulfill my vows to the Lord*s in*ln the presence of all his people,
in*ln the courts of the Lord’s*s house — within*ln you, Jerusalem. Hallelujah!*ln
